$result_collection

$result_collection : \Aura\Signal\ResultCollection

A prototype ResultCollection; this will be cloned by `send()` to retain the Result objects from Handler instances.

A factory to create Handler objects.

A factory to create Result objects.

A prototype ResultCollection.
array $handlers

An array describing Handler params.

Tags

None found

handler()

handler(string|object $sender, string $signal, callback $callback, int $position) : void

Adds a Handler to respond to a sender signal.

Parameters

string|object $sender

The class or object sender of the signal. If a class, inheritance will be honored, and '*' will be interpreted as "any class."
string $signal

The name of the signal for that sender.
callback $callback

The callback to execute when the signal is received.
int $position

The handler processing position; lower numbers are processed first. Use this to force a handler to be used before or after others.

Tags

None found

getHandlers()

getHandlers(string $signal) : array

Gets Handler instances for the Manager.

Parameters

string $signal

Only get Handler instances for this signal; if null, get all Handler instances.

Returns

array

Tags

None found

send()

send(object $origin, string $signal) : \Aura\Signal\ResultCollection

Invokes the Handler objects for a sender and signal.

Parameters

object $origin

The object sending the signal. Note that this is always an object, not a class name.
string $signal

The name of the signal from that origin.

Returns

\Aura\Signal\ResultCollection —

The results from each of the Handler objects.

Tags

params

Arguments to pass to the Handler callback.

getResults()

getResults() : \Aura\Signal\ResultCollection

Returns the ResultCollection from the last signal processing.

Returns

\Aura\Signal\ResultCollection

Tags

None found

process()

process(object $origin, string $signal, array $args)

Invokes the Handler objects for a sender and signal.

Parameters

object $origin

The object sending the signal. Note that this is always an object, not a class name.
string $signal

The name of the signal from that origin.
array $args

Arguments to pass to the Handler callback.
